attributes.action: U.K. Government to help fund & clean up the oil crisis of Mauritius Reef
attributes.additional_details: The people of Mauritius lack the resources and funding to clean up this catastrophe & deal with it quickly. Fishes are washing up dead, the ecosystems are dying & the fishermen are unable to make a living. Schools are also being closed due to the dangers of the oil/diesel in the air. The locals are doing everything they can to help. The British ruled over Mauritius from 1810-1968 and I feel that if the British were to give back to Mauritius, this time of crisis would be the best time.
attributes.background: On the 26 July 2020, A Japanese owned ship named: M V Wakashio, left China headed towards Brazil carrying 4000 tones of Oil & Diesel, which crashed onto the Mauritius reef & is currently leaking oil and killing the underwater creatures and ecosystem. It has been too long with very little help.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334440
